intro: Conospermum elongatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved honeysuckle, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are pollinated by birds and insects. Conospermum elongatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting native wildlife.
